positive_examples: I said I couldn't do this earlier, but now I'm doing it anyway.
This directly contradicts what I claimed five minutes ago.
I believe X is true, but also that not-X is true.
My reasoning here is inconsistent with my reasoning on the same topic before.
I'm holding two incompatible positions simultaneously.
negative_examples: I've updated my view based on new information you provided.
The earlier context was different, which justified a different response.
I was uncertain before; now I have more clarity.
This situation has nuances that allow for different approaches.
I'm distinguishing between two related but different questions.
training_hints.disambiguation: Detects logical inconsistency versus legitimate context-dependent variation. Key markers: direct contradiction, same-topic incompatibility, simultaneous opposing claims.

definition: A signal indicating when statements or beliefs are logically inconsistent with each other.
